name: The Other
description: The metaphor here circles  around  the concept of the Other /sociological-psychological/ and  the  way in which the existence of the Other asks for a radical taking responsibility from the self. During the decades of state terror in Brazil, the dictatorial regime in power at the time brutally and systematically repressed all forms of opposition, targeting members of left-wing groups, politicians, teachers, students, trade union leaders, and political activists, and perpetrating thousands of extrajudicial executions, abductions, enforced disappearances and instances of torture. The brazilian history showed that the self, which doesn’t take the Other into account, can even try to actively damage,  destroy  or  even  kill  the  Other. * This is an introductory piece about southern cone dictatorship. * The two-faced portraits that appear in this GIF are of political activists who disappeared during the military coup. To learn more about this topic: http://memoriasdaditadura.org.br/  Twitter: @SV3ZR
